Hello Denny any chance you could fix the N1 it seems to have a scaling issue

Hello! Have anyone tried using OLDD Saturn V with Realism Overhaul mod? If yes, did anyone have a problem, where the game couldn't load the craft file. When i click on a craft, the game loads only a command module (which i can't move at all) and the craft name on top changes "Vessel Name" and none of the part categories in the editor are available. Can anyone answer what's wrong, please?

Yes, I had this issue with another replica which I used in realism overhaul too, when I loaded the craft file the same happened as you described it. It is probably because the craft file wants to load the "old, small" parts, but they are scaled bigger and many changes to the config were made, so the craft can't be loaded. You probably have to build it yourselve, that was what I made.
OMG, it will be quite hard without proper manual . Maybe someone has a craft file, which will work in a Realism overhaul?
Well, it isn't too different from building the normal one and plus, the Apollo Spacecraft is the most complicated part. The Saturn V itself is more straightforward to build.

Could you please:

a. Fix the actual ship file, it doesn't seem to work in .90, however the parts do work. Assembling this thing piece by piece is a pain in the ass

b. Change the tank types to be correct. The S-II and S-IV were both balloon cryogenic tanks, however in this mod they are both regular tanks. (Boil off is a huge problem, because the tanks that need insulation don't have insulation. It also messes with the stats of the ship, in terms of TWR and Delta V.)

I just want to say, "Wow"....

I have seen this mod for a long time, but had never taken time to take her out for test drive.

It is beautiful, flies great and the detail is fantastic.

I was born in 60, so the space race was #1 tv... I still remember the launches on the crummy b/w set, but they were still great.

This package brought back lots of memories...

Again, +++++

Cheers.
Okay the LEM descent stage has some real issues. It does not fire its engine true. It keeps veering off course it is impossible to hold it true.

Could you please:

a. Fix the actual ship file, it doesn't seem to work in .90, however the parts do work. Assembling this thing piece by piece is a pain in the ass

b. Change the tank types to be correct. The S-II and S-IV were both balloon cryogenic tanks, however in this mod they are both regular tanks. (Boil off is a huge problem, because the tanks that need insulation don't have insulation. It also messes with the stats of the ship, in terms of TWR and Delta V.)

Sounds like you're using Realism Overhaul. If you are, then please don't ask for support from the part maker, but rather on the RO thread (and you certainly shouldn't expect a craft file made for the original partmod to work after RO changes everything around!)

As for B, no, no they were not balloon tanks. Balloon tanks are what Atlas and Centaur used, tanks where there was no structure, the tank itself *was* the stage structure (and had to be kept pressurized at all times or the stage would collapse, hence the name). You're getting confused between that and "common bulkhead" stages, where the top of one tank serves as the bottom of the other. S-II and S-IV and S-IVB were all common bulkhead stages (unlike S-IC), but they were certainly not balloon tanked.
whats the difference between this and fasa?

I love your mods, by far the very best rocket modelling in KSP.

I have your Saturn-V/Apollo and Proton mods and they are great (would be a bit better if you had a pre-assembled "stock" file so i could just load it and fit the payload from the sub-assemblies, rather than build the rocket and put in the sub-assemblies area where i would maybe be missing parts)

Ever thought of doing a Soyuz-FG, Ares-1, Atlas-V 551, Titan-IV, Space Shuttle/Buran? . . . Maybe even an ICBM like the RT-2PM missile? (compatible with Real Solar System and Realism Overhaul)

Amazing work, would love to see more.
